description: CRITICAL: Domain concepts must stay at the domain level, even if concrete. Don't separate technical details from domain concepts—they should be the same (class vs object vs file—all represent the same domain concept).

do.description: Stay at domain level, even if concrete
content: Domain concepts should represent domain objects directly
Technical details (saving, loading) are part of domain concepts
Class vs object vs file - all represent the same domain concept
Save portfolio: None (saves to persistent storage)
Load portfolio: AccountId (loads from persistent storage)
Don't separate 'saving something' from the domain object
Don't separate technical implementation details from domain concepts
Save portfolio to file: Portfolio, FilePath
- Classes ending in 'Saver', 'Loader', 'Storage' that separate technical concerns
- Separating persistence logic from domain objects
